comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9

In the Window 'Cookies', found under 'Page Info>Security>Show Cookies', you can see all cookies of a domain. They appear live as they are created.
Removed Cookies don't disappear,
Recreated ones show up as double, until the window is closed and reopened.


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open 'Cookie' window
2. show Cookies for  winware.org
3. goto http://winware.org/de/cookietest.php
4. create cookie via Webpage
>cookie will show up in 'Cookie'-Window. PERFECT.
5. delete cookie via Webpage
>nothing happens in 'Cookie'-Window. COOKIE SHOULD DISAPPEAR
6. recreate cookie via Webpage
>2nd cookie will show up in 'Cookie'-Window. --->BUG.
Actual Results:  
See 'Steps to reproduce'

Expected Results:  
'Cookies'-Window should either show ALL changes live, or NONE.
Preferaby ALL ;-)

Confirmed problem with:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110120 Firefox/4.0b10pre

With SeaMonkey 2.1b2pre the Cookie tab in the Data Manager handles the STR correctly. However a similar problem occurs if you create two or more cookies and then delete them one by one.
